00016 #define MAX_ITERATIONS 10 // It is completely uncritical to hardcode this vaule.
00017                          // As it is used twice in the code I introduced a define.
00018 
00019 // the static variables for the number of channels per chip and chips per modue
00020 Int_t SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::_nChannelsPerChip = 18;
00021 Int_t SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::_nChipsPerModule = 12;
00022 
00023 SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo(Int_t runNumber, std::string AHCConfigFileName,
00024                                                      bool apply5RMSCut,  std::string runFileName,
00025                                                      unsigned int moduleTypes)
00026   : _runNumber( runNumber) , createdTree(true), _moduleTypeMask(moduleTypes)
00027 {
00028   if (!AHCConfigFileName.empty())
00029   {
00030     _simpleMapper = new SimpleMapper( AHCConfigFileName );
00031   }
00032   else 
00033   {
00034     _simpleMapper = 0;
00035   }
00036 
00037   if ( !openRunFile( runFileName ) )
00038   {
00039     //opening the run file failed. Set the class to a safe state
00040     _channelSpectrumProperties = 0;
00041     _spectrumPropertiesTree = 0;
00042     _runNumber = -1;
00043     return;
00044   }
00045 
00046   // Create the tree from the input file.
00047   // First allocate the data class and the tree.
00048 
00049   // Change to the gROOT directory. This is the main memory root allocates.
00050   // Like this the next object (the tree) will be creates in memory and not
00051   // associated to any file. 
00052   // To write it to a file do:
00053   // file->cd();
00054   // tree->Write();
00055   gROOT->cd();
00056 
00057   // Create the tree in memory:
00058   _spectrumPropertiesTree = new TTree;
00059   _channelSpectrumProperties = new TChannelSpectrumProperties;
00060   _spectrumPropertiesTree->Branch("spectrumPropertiesTree","TChannelSpectrumProperties", &_channelSpectrumProperties);
00061 
00062   // Initialisation takes some time. print the status every 5 %
00063   // Some variables neede for this
00064   Int_t nEntries = _runFile->GetListOfKeys()->GetEntries();
00065   Int_t entry = 0;
00066   Int_t printEvery = nEntries / 20;
00067 
00068   std::cout << "SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo: reading input histograms, please wait... " << std::endl;
00069 
00070   // Now iterate all the keys in the file 
00071   TIterator * keyIter = _runFile->GetListOfKeys()->MakeIterator();
00072   while ( TKey *key = dynamic_cast<TKey *>(keyIter->Next())  )
00073   {
00074     if ( entry%printEvery == 0)
00075     {
00076       std::cout << "processed  " << entry*100 / nEntries << "%"<< std::endl;
00077     }
00078 
00079     // Count up the number of entries for the status coutput
00080     entry++;
00081     
00082     TH1D *histo = dynamic_cast<TH1D*>( key->ReadObj() );
00083     // check that the cast was successful, otherwise it was not a TH1D
00084     if (histo ==0) continue;
00085     
00086     // determine the configuration variables from the histogram title
00087     // the variables we want to scan for
00088     int crcSer       = -1;
00089     int slot         = -1;
00090     int frontEnd     = -1;
00091     int chip         = -1;
00092     int channel      = -1;
00093     int module       = -1;
00094     int layer        = -1;
00095 
00096     // try the old version without mapping
00097     int nNumbersRead = sscanf(histo->GetTitle(), "SER%d, Slot %d, FE%d, Chip %d, Chan %d", 
00098                                                &crcSer, &slot, &frontEnd, &chip, &channel);
00099     if (nNumbersRead == 5)
00100     {
00101       // ok, it's the old syntax. try to ger the mapping from the simpleMapper
00102 
00103       if (_simpleMapper)
00104       {
00105         if ( ! (_simpleMapper->getModuleType( SimpleMapper::SlotFrontendID(slot,frontEnd))
00106                 & _moduleTypeMask) )
00107         {
00108           // module type does not fit the moduleMask, just continue
00109           delete histo;
00110           continue;
00111         }
00112 
00113         // get module and layer from the config
00114         SimpleMapper::ModuleLayerID moduleLayerID = 
00115           _simpleMapper->getModuleLayerID( SimpleMapper::SlotFrontendID(slot,frontEnd) );
00116 
00117         if (_simpleMapper->isAHC8( SimpleMapper::SlotFrontendID(slot,frontEnd) ) )
00118         {
00119           // the hard coded geometry for AHC8:
00120           // Chips 4 to 7 are not present, as well as channels 0 to 2 on chip 8.
00121           // Just continue the loop
00122           if (chip >= 4 && chip <=7)
00123           {
00124             delete histo;
00125             continue;
00126           }
00127           if (chip == 8 && channel <=2 )
00128           {
00129             delete histo;
00130             continue;
00131           }
00132         }
00133         module = moduleLayerID.first;
00134         layer  = moduleLayerID.second;
00135       }
00136       else
00137       {
00138         std::cout << "No mapping from AHC.cfg availabel and it has not bee done in ahcBinHst."
00139                   << std::endl;
00140         std::cout << "Please provide the name of the AHC.cfg file."
00141                   << std::endl;
00142         delete histo;
00143         continue;
00144       }// else _simpleMapper
00145     }
00146     else// if (nNumbersRead == 5)
00147     {
00148       // try the new title format which is alredy mapped 
00149       int nNumbersRead = sscanf(histo->GetTitle(), "Module %d, Layer %d, Chip %d, Channel %d", 
00150                                 &module, &layer, &chip, &channel);
00151  
00152       if (nNumbersRead != 4)
00153       {
00154         std::cout << "Histogram titles do not have the right format."
00155                   << std::endl;
00156         delete histo;
00157         continue;       
00158       }
00159     }
00160     
00161     // fill the map with the ChannelID -> histoTitle correlation
00162     _histogramTitleMap[ChannelID( module, chip, channel )] 
00163       = std::string(histo->GetTitle());
00164 
00165     // apply the 5*rms cut if turned on
00166     if(apply5RMSCut)
00167     {
00168       double mean = histo->GetMean();
00169       double rms  = histo->GetRMS();
00170 
00171       // set nIterations outside the loop so we can check it after the loop has finished
00172       unsigned int nIterations = 0;
00173       for ( /* not set here */; nIterations < MAX_ITERATIONS; nIterations++ )
00174       {
00175         // limit the histogram to mean +- 5*rms
00176         histo->GetXaxis()->SetRangeUser( mean - 5*rms, mean + 5*rms );
00177         
00178         if (rms == histo->GetRMS() )
00179         { // the rms is identical to the previous iteration: algoythm has converged
00180           break;
00181         }
00182         else
00183         { // remember the current values for the next iteration
00184           mean = histo->GetMean();
00185           rms  = histo->GetRMS();
00186         }
00187       }// for nIterations
00188 
00189       if (nIterations == MAX_ITERATIONS)
00190       {
00191         std::cout << "SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo: Warning, 5*RMS cut did not converge in 10 iterations on module "
00192                   << module << " , chip " << chip << " , channel " << channel << std::endl;
00193       }
00194     }
00195 
00196 
00197     _channelSpectrumProperties->Set( module, chip,  channel, 
00198                                      histo->GetMean(), histo->GetRMS() );
00199 
00200     // fill the tree
00201     _spectrumPropertiesTree->Fill();
00202 
00203     // in addition to filling the tree also fill the map for random accress
00204     _channelSpectrumPropertiesMap[ ChannelID( module, chip, channel ) ] = *_channelSpectrumProperties;
00205 
00206     // ROOT created a clone of the object in the file in memory. We don't need it anymore.
00207     // Delete it in order not to fill up the memory.
00208     delete histo;
00209   }
00210   std::cout << "processed  100%"<< std::endl;
00211 
00212 }

00217 SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::~SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo()
00218 {
00219   // the tree is not associated with a file, we have to delete it manually
00220   if (createdTree) // only delete if the tree was created in the constructor
00221   {
00222     delete _spectrumPropertiesTree;
00223   }
00224 
00225   // get rid of the open input file
00226   if (_runFile)
00227   {
00228     _runFile->Close();
00229     delete _runFile;
00230   }
00231   delete _simpleMapper;
00232 }
00233 SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo(Int_t runNumber,
00234                                                      TTree * spectrumPropertiesTree)
00235   : _runNumber( runNumber) , _simpleMapper(0), _spectrumPropertiesTree( spectrumPropertiesTree ),
00236     _channelSpectrumProperties(0), createdTree(false), _moduleTypeMask(0)
00237 {
00238   _spectrumPropertiesTree->SetBranchAddress("spectrumPropertiesTree",&_channelSpectrumProperties);
00239 
00240   // fill the properties map from the tree
00241   for (int i=0; i<_spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntries(); i++)
00242   {
00243     _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntry(i);
00244     _channelSpectrumPropertiesMap[ ChannelID(_channelSpectrumProperties->_module,
00245                                              _channelSpectrumProperties->_chip,
00246                                              _channelSpectrumProperties->_channel) ]
00247       = *_channelSpectrumProperties;    
00248   }
00249 
00250   // currently there is no need to open the run file since the map to access the histo names is not
00251   // filled.
00252   // openRunFile(std::string runFileName);
00253   _runFile=0;
00254 }

00256 TTree * SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getSpectrumPropertiesTree()
00257 {
00258   return _spectrumPropertiesTree;
00259 }

00262 void SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::print(std::string fileName ) const 
00263 {
00264   std::ostream *myOutputStream;
00265   if (fileName.empty())
00266   {
00267     myOutputStream = &std::cout;
00268   }
00269   else
00270   {
00271     myOutputStream = new std::ofstream( fileName.c_str() , std::ios::out );
00272   }
00273 
00274   *myOutputStream << "#SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo for run " << _runNumber << std::endl;
00275   *myOutputStream << "#module" << "\t" << "chip"     << "\t" << "channel" << "\t"
00276                   << "mean"   << "\t" << "rms" << std::endl;
00277   // n.b. The << for every \t is to improve code readability AND have the same
00278   // spacing in the final output ( << "module \t chip" would add another space)
00279 
00280   for (Int_t i = 0; i <  _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntries(); i++)
00281   {
00282     _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntry(i);
00283     *myOutputStream << _channelSpectrumProperties->_module  <<"\t"
00284                     << _channelSpectrumProperties->_chip    <<"\t"
00285                     << _channelSpectrumProperties->_channel <<"\t"
00286                     << _channelSpectrumProperties->_mean    <<"\t"
00287                     << _channelSpectrumProperties->_rms     << std::endl;
00288   }
00289 
00290   if (!fileName.empty())
00291   {
00292     // we just created an ofstream. Delete it 
00293     delete myOutputStream;
00294   }
00295 }
00296 
00297 bool SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID::operator<(SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID const & right) const 
00298 {
00299   if (_module == right._module)
00300   { // module numbers are equal, use chip ID instead
00301     if (_chip == right._chip)
00302     { // chip IDs are equal, use channel number 
00303       return _channel < right._channel;
00304     }
00305     else // chip numbers differ, use them
00306     {
00307       return _chip < right._chip;
00308     }
00309   }
00310   else // module number differs, use it to distinguish
00311   {
00312     return _module < right._module;
00313   }
00314 }

00318 {}

00320 std::vector< SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID >  SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getNoisyChannels( Double_t noisyCut ) const
00321 {
00322   return getChannelsWithRMSCut(noisyCut);
00323 }
00324 
00325 std::vector< SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID >  SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getChannelsWithRMSCut(Double_t lowerCut,
00326                                                                                   Double_t upperCut) const 
00327 {
00328   // the return value
00329   std::vector< SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID > channelsWithRMSCut;
00330 
00331   // loop the tree and fill the return vector
00332   for (Int_t entry = 0; entry < _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntries(); entry++)
00333   {
00334     _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntry( entry );
00335     if ( (_channelSpectrumProperties->_rms >= lowerCut) && (_channelSpectrumProperties->_rms <= upperCut) )
00336     {
00337       // channel rms is within cut range, add it to the return vector
00338       channelsWithRMSCut.push_back( ChannelID( _channelSpectrumProperties->_module,
00339                                                _channelSpectrumProperties->_chip,
00340                                                _channelSpectrumProperties->_channel ) );
00341     }
00342   }
00343 
00344   return channelsWithRMSCut;
00345 }
00346 
00347 std::vector< SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID >  SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getChannelsWithMeanCut(Double_t lowerCut,
00348                                                                                    Double_t upperCut) const 
00349 {
00350   // the return value
00351   std::vector< SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID > channelsWithMeanCut;
00352 
00353   // loop the tree and fill the return vector
00354   for (Int_t entry = 0; entry < _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntries(); entry++)
00355   {
00356     _spectrumPropertiesTree->GetEntry( entry );
00357     if ( (_channelSpectrumProperties->_mean >= lowerCut) && (_channelSpectrumProperties->_mean <= upperCut) )
00358     {
00359       // channel rms is within cut range, add it to the return vector
00360       channelsWithMeanCut.push_back( ChannelID( _channelSpectrumProperties->_module,
00361                                                _channelSpectrumProperties->_chip,
00362                                                _channelSpectrumProperties->_channel ) );
00363     }
00364   }
00365 
00366   return channelsWithMeanCut;
00367 }

00369 void SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::printChannels( std::vector< SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID >  const & listOfChannels )
00370 {
00371 
00372   std::cout << "# module chip channel" << std::endl;
00373   for ( std::vector<ChannelID>::const_iterator chanIDIter = listOfChannels.begin();
00374         chanIDIter < listOfChannels.end(); chanIDIter++)
00375   {
00376 
00377     std::cout << chanIDIter->_module << "\t"
00378               << chanIDIter->_chip << "\t"

00382 
00383 TH1D * SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getChannelHisto( SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID channelID)
00384 {
00385   if (_histogramTitleMap.size() == 0)
00386   {
00387     std::cerr << "Accessing the histograms when creating the SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo "
00388               << " class from a tree is not supported yet." 
00389               << " Write the populateHistogramTitleMap() function" << std::endl;
00390     return 0;
00391   }
00392   
00393   if (_runFile && _runFile->IsOpen() )
00394   {
00395     return dynamic_cast<TH1D *>(_runFile->Get( _histogramTitleMap[channelID].c_str() ));
00396   }
00397   else
00398   {
00399     std::cout << "Sorry, the runFile could not be opened and the hist could not be read"
00400               << std::endl;
00401     return 0;
00402   }
00403 }

00419 
00420 Int_t SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getGlobalChannelNumber( ChannelID const & channelID )
00421 {
00422   return ( channelID._module * _nChipsPerModule + channelID._chip ) * _nChannelsPerChip
00423          + channelID._channel;
00424 }
00425 
00426 SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::ChannelID SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getChannelID( Int_t globalChannelNumber )
00427 {
00428   ChannelID retval;
00429 
00430   // n.b. this is an integer division. The rest is just discarded.
00431   retval._module = globalChannelNumber / (_nChipsPerModule*_nChannelsPerChip);
00432   retval._chip =  (globalChannelNumber / _nChannelsPerChip) % _nChipsPerModule;
00433   retval._channel = globalChannelNumber % _nChannelsPerChip;
00434 
00435   return retval;
00436 }

00452 TChannelSpectrumProperties SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getChannelSpectrumProperties(  ChannelID const & channelID) const
00453 {
00454   // search if the channel ID exists. We do not want to access
00455   // map[] because this would create the object if not there and spoil the map.
00456   std::map< ChannelID, TChannelSpectrumProperties >::const_iterator channelSpectrumPropertiesIter = 
00457     _channelSpectrumPropertiesMap.find(channelID);
00458 
00459   if ( channelSpectrumPropertiesIter != _channelSpectrumPropertiesMap.end() )
00460   {
00461     return channelSpectrumPropertiesIter->second;
00462   }
00463   
00464   // in case the object was not found return an "empty" ChannelID. All ID values are -1
00465   return TChannelSpectrumProperties();
00466 }
00467

00469 {
00470   return getChannelSpectrumProperties( getChannelID( globalChannelNumber ) );
00471 }

00478 THStack *  SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::drawGetDeadChannelsPlot( Double_t deadCut, Double_t xAxisMax)
00479 {
00480   TH1D * rmsHisto = new TH1D("runHisto", "RMS Spectrum Run ", 100, 0, xAxisMax);
00481 
00482   TH1D * deadHisto = new TH1D("deadHisto", "RMS Spectrum of Dead Channel", 100, 0, xAxisMax);
00483   deadHisto->SetLineColor(kRed);
00484 
00485   // fill the histograms
00486   for (std::map< ChannelID, TChannelSpectrumProperties >::const_iterator channelSpectrumPropertiesIter 
00487          = _channelSpectrumPropertiesMap.begin();
00488        channelSpectrumPropertiesIter != _channelSpectrumPropertiesMap.end(); channelSpectrumPropertiesIter++ )
00489   {
00490     TChannelSpectrumProperties const & channelSpectrumProperties = channelSpectrumPropertiesIter->second;
00491 
00492     rmsHisto->Fill( channelSpectrumProperties._rms );
00493     if ( channelSpectrumProperties._rms < deadCut )
00494     {
00495       deadHisto->Fill( channelSpectrumProperties._rms );
00496     }
00497   }
00498 
00499   TString stackTitle("RMS Spectrum and Dead Channels, Run ");
00500   stackTitle += _runNumber;
00501 
00502   THStack * hStack = new THStack("deadHStack",stackTitle);
00503 
00504   hStack->Add( rmsHisto );
00505   hStack->Add( deadHisto );
00506 
00507   // Draw one before setting the axis labels. The reason is that the axes don't exist before
00508   // begin drawn :-O
00509   hStack->Draw("nostack");
00510 
00511   hStack->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("RMS [ADC Counts]");
00512   hStack->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Number of Entries");
00513 
00514   // redraw with axis labels
00515   hStack->Draw("nostack");
00516 
00517   return hStack;
00518 }

00520 Int_t SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::getRunNumber() const
00521 {
00522   return _runNumber;
00523 }
00524 
00525 //  if ( !openRunFileName )
00526 bool SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo::openRunFile( std::string runFileName )
00527 {
00528   TString fileName; //helper name, nice since TString has += operator
00529 
00530   // Generate the file name for the runFile. This is the input file.
00531   if (runFileName.empty())
00532   { // no file name given. Create it from the run number
00533     fileName += _runNumber; // the string was empty, start with the number
00534     fileName += ".root"; // append the .root suffix
00535   }
00536   else
00537   {
00538     fileName = runFileName;
00539   }
00540 
00541   _runFile = new TFile(fileName);
00542 
00543   if (!_runFile->IsOpen() )
00544   {
00545     std::cerr << "SpectrumPropertiesRunInfo: File "<< fileName << " could not be opened" << std::endl;
00546     // set the class to a safe state
00547     delete _runFile;
00548     _runFile = 0;
00549     return false;
00550   }
00551   else
00552   {
00553     return true;
00554   }
00555 }
